Basics of Editing

This guide is for new editors who may not be familiar with wiki editing or editing in general. This guide only requires:

  • an account on lurker.pro
  • an account with editor permissions (which you most likely have)

Creating an Article

To create an article, navigate to the namespace1) of your choosing. Add a forward slash after the namespace, then the name of the page you wish to create2) (ex. ableton/plugins/beatrepeat). If the page has not been created, you will be shown a blank page. You are then able to create said page and edit it freely.

Editing a Page or Article

There are no distinctions between pages and articles besides their content. However, for the sake of this guide, “pages” contain content that directs the user, and “articles” contain content that explains a topic to the user. For example, lurker.pro/editing is a page or namespace, and lurker.pro/editing/basics is an article.

1) For example, in lurker.pro/ableton/guides, ableton is the namespace and guides is a page
2) You may also type ?do=edit after the page name to begin editing immediately
